summary: Kenneth S. McHargh was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents detail his name, social security number, position, salary, and period of employment within the HSCA. The documents indicate his involvement with the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Kenneth S. McHargh's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee responsible for reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his contribution to the committee's work.
